The delegation met with Mr. Janis Sarts, State Secretary of the Ministry of Defense of Latvia, and Major General Raimonds Graube, Commander of Latvian National Armed Forces, respectively. http://lv.china-embassy.gov.cn/eng/xwdt/201110/t20111020_9509286.htm                                                                     (2012) - Chinese defense minister meets with Latvian counterpart. AM.evidence: In the framework of the visit to the People’s Republic of China (in 2023), Minister of Defence of the Republic of Armenia Suren Papikyan had a meeting with the Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission of PRC, a member of the Politburo of the “Chinese Communist Party”, Colonel General He Weidong. During the meeting, a number of issues related to the cooperation in the defence field and its potential for development were discussed. Both parties emphasized the significant potential for expanding cooperation in various areas. https://www.mil.am/en/news/11840
AM.note: (2017) - Guan met with Defense Minister Vigen Sargsian, the chief of the Armenian army staff, Lieutenant General Movses Hakobian, and Deputy Defense Minister Davit Pakhchanian during the trip. Pakhchanian runs a Defense Ministry division overseeing the Armenian defense industry.https://www.azatutyun.am/a/28430829.html

PE.evidence: Senior Colonel Leng Bingkun, Defense Attaché of the People's Republic of China in the Republic of Peru, made a protocol visit to various military institutions in Peru. Therefore, this indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PE.note: Senior Colonel Leng Bingkun held meetings with Army General Walter Córdova Alemán, General Commander of the Army; General Commander of the Peruvian Air Force, Air General Alfonso Javier Artadi Saletti, Division General (R) Walter Martos Ruiz, General Director of the CAEN-EPG and Doctor Roberto Vizcardo Benavides, Director of the “Gral Div José del Carmen” Research Institute “Marín Arista”.

VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: In 2017, the Chilean Army's commander in Chief visited the PLA with the objective of deepening links between the two organizations. There are skimmed articles about different types of exchanges since at least 2006 so we assume that it is a common practice. In 2019 the Chilean Ministry of Defense met the subdirector of the office of military cooperation, Major Huang Xueping, in the context of the third meeting for defense cooperation between Chile and China. In the same line, in October, 2023, the sub-director of the Chilean Hydrological and Oceanographic Center (SHOA) which is part of the Chilean Navy, met with the Chinese CEA director, Min Yiren. Again, we need to assume that not all information is published. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

AF.evidence: Afghanistan's ambassador to Beijing stated that China would train Afghan troops on Chinese soil. This military cooperation was described as an effort to fight al Qaeda and Islamic State militants, with Afghanistan also requesting China provide combat helicopters for Afghan security forces. While there have been denials of Chinese troops stationed in Afghanistan, the provision of military training on Chinese soil indicates a level of military cooperation between the two countries.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

IN.evidence:
On April 27, 2023 Shri Rajnath Singh met State Councillor and Minister of National Defence of China General Li Shangfu in New Delhi. At the same time, since the 2020 border clash, there has been at-least 20 rounds of talk. As such, this indicator response is "more than few" rating and insignificant as there has been no resolution to the border issue after all the bilateral talks and meetings.
At the same time, talks have also been conducted under the framework of the Working Mechanism for Consultation and Coordination on India-China Border Affairs(WMCC) and the latest was the 28th meeting held on 30th November, 2023 with agreements on continuation of talks.
IN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

KE.evidence: Kenya Navy Commander Major General (Maj Gen) Jimson Mutai met with Chinese Defence Attachè (DA) to Kenya, Senior Colonel Qiu Yawei on 14 February 2023, at the Kenya Navy (KN) Headquarters. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Meetings with defence attaches are common and are expected as part of the engagements of senior military leaders. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.

VN.evidence:
We have found mentions of several meetings on a very high level. (1) Defense Minister of Vietnam visiting China and participating in the Beijing Xiangshan forum. (2) High ranking officers meeting during the joint exercise in Guangdong province. (3) Several other meetings also took place, but below the one-star rank on the PRC side. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Few" and "Significant" rating.
on January 12,2024, Deputy Defense Minister Senior Lieutenant General Hoang Xuan Chien received Colonel Yu Qiang, Chinese Deputy Defense Attaché to Vietnam  at the Headquarters of the Ministry of National Defense.
Chinese defense minister meets Vietnamese counterpart
VN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NP.evidence: In 2023, Chief of Army Staff COAS General Prabhuram Sharma and the Chinese Major General Yue Ande of the Tibet Military Command of the People's Liberation Army took place at the headquarters of the Nepali Army. CoAS Sharma during his trip to Beijing in 2023 for the 10th Beijing Xiangshan Forum  held a meeting with Joint Chief of Staff Gen. Liu Zhenli of the Central Military Commission (CMC), People's Liberation Army (PLA). In 2023, an eight-member border defence delegation from China with CoAS Sharma
NP.answerer: Answered by Sriparna Pathak, and has been reviewed by Amish Mulmi

RU.evidence: In June 2023, Russian Chief of General Staff Valery Gerasimov held talks with Liu Zhengli, head of the Joint Staff of China's Central Military Council. In April 2023, a Chinese delegation visited the Military Academy of the General Staff, and more than 20 Chinese servicemen are set to start their education there in the autumn. In August 2023, there was a bilateral meeting between the Ministries of Defense of the two countries.
RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.evidence: The secretary of defence met with General Li Zuocheng (L), member of China’s Central Military Commission in January 2022 - I classed this as insignificant as it did not appear to have any long-lasting effect on NZ's defence policy, details of the attendees of the New Zealand China strategic defence dialogue in 2023 are not available
NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.evidence: Senior military leaders have attended bilateral meetings with PLA officers - this includes General Chiwenga's visit to PRC just before the 2017 military coup in Zimbabwe.
ZW.answerer: Answered by Ernest Mudzengi, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: In may 2023, DRC defense ministry met with China general Li shangfu in a bilateral meeting
CD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula

MY.evidence: Senior Malaysian military and civilian defense leaders have participated in bilateral meetings with PLA officers at or above the one-star rank in the past, peaking in 2017 before declining and stagnating. There is no evidence of such meetings taking place after 2022. Even though two Chinese naval vessels visited Penang, Malaysia, in early October 2024, led by Chinese Rear Admirals, no reports indicate that senior Malaysian military or civilian defense leaders met with them.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.evidence: A Chinese PLA delegation for international military cooperation visited Timor-Leste from August 14-18, 2024, where they met with leaders from Timor-Leste's Ministry of Defense and military. The meetings concluded with a consensus to enhance bilateral defense cooperation between the two countries.
TL.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AR.evidence: The Argentine Minister of Defense, Jorge Taiana, participated in an event for the 96th anniversay of the founding of the PLA, along with the Defense Attaché, Major Colonel Liu Miao. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

UY.evidence: Uruguayan Chief of the Air Defense Staff General Rodolfo Pereyra met with the Senior Colonel Geo Feng, Defense Attaché of the PRC's Embassy in the Eastern Republic of Uruguay, as well as Assistant to the Defense Attaché Major Shou. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
UY.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

SV.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
SV.answerer: Answered by Eric Lemus, and has been reviewed by Julio Martinez and Alvaro Cruz

PH.evidence: Defense Secretary Gilberto Teodoro and Armed Forces of the Philippines Chief of Staff General Romeo Brawner never had a bilateral meeting with PLA officers. Both officers, however, were able to have a closed-door meeting with Chinese Ambassador Huang Xilian in July 2023. Huang also had a courtesy call with Brawner's predecessor, General Andres Centino back in February 2023.
PH.note:
In December 2023, Senator JV Ejercito revealed that AFP Chief of Staff General Romeo Brawner Jr. told him that in one occasion, Chinese Ambassador to the Philippines Huang Xilian confronted the general and even aggressively pointed at him while saying, “Don’t provoke us,” in relation to the issue of the South China Sea. 

1) https://www.onenews.ph/articles/dinuro-pa-jv-ejercito-reveals-chinese-ambassador-bullied-afp-chief
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

TH.evidence:
In 2021, Thai Army Chief Gen Narongphat NJitkaewthae met with Chinese Defence Minister in Beijing. 

In September 2023, China-Thailand Blue Strike-2023 joint naval training exercise concluded, marking the fifth edition of the Blue Strike bilateral naval exercises held since 2010.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.evidence: In May 2023, Major-General Yang Yang, the acting director-general of the Intelligence Bureau of China's Central Military Commission's Joint Staff Department, visited Myanmar and held discussions with the deputy commander-in-chief of the Myanmar military. Later, in October 2023, Myanmar's Minister for Defence, Admiral Tin Aung San, met with Vice-Chairman Zhang Youxia of China’s Central Military Commission (CMC) in Beijing. This meeting took place during Admiral Tin Aung San's attendance at the Beijing Xiangshan Forum, which is the largest annual event for military diplomacy in the country.
MM.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

UG.evidence: To buttress its already vast economic footprint in several African countries, including Uganda, the Chinese government through its army; the People’s Liberation Army (PLA), is constantly engaging army officers in Africa, including through training programs, bilateral meetings, and exchanges with their Chinese counterparts.
UG.answerer: Answered by Abdou Rahim Lema, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AO.evidence: There's a long history of military collaboration between Angola and China in multiple areas.

Indonesian Defense Minister Prabowo Subianto met with Chinese State Council member and Defense Minister Wei Fenghe in Xian city, Shaanxi province in 2023

KH.evidence: Yes, regular meetings take place between Cambodian senior military leaders and their Chinese counterparts.
KH.answerer: Answered by Bradley J. Murg, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Air Force Gen. CQ Brown, Jr. held talks with his Chinese military counterpart, People's Liberation Army Gen. Liu Zhenli.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.evidence: Since 2016, there is a high-ranking security dialogue between China and Germany.
DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this statement.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: In the 2022 Shangri-La Dialogue, Defence Minister Richard Marles and his Chinese counterpart Wei Fenghe has a bilateral meeting, where they explored resuming their regular high-level military dialogue, which had been suspended in 2019. The last edition of the Australia-China Defence Strategic Dialogue happened in 2019, when Australia's Defence Secretary and Chief of the Defence Force met the Director of the Joint Staff Department of the Central Military Commission, General Li Zuocheng. As the meeting during the Shangri-La Dialogue is mainly exploratory, this Indicator has been given an 'Insignificant' rating.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
